skill.name: virtual-machine-management
skill.description: Create, manage, and optimize virtual machines in Proxmox. Control VM lifecycle, monitor performance, adjust resources, and plan VM deployment strategies.
skill.summary: Create, manage, and optimize virtual machines in Proxmox. Control VM lifecycle, monitor performance,...
skill.author: DataKnifeAI

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only SKILL.md with no executable code. The skill defines MCP tool interfaces for Proxmox VM management but contains no scripts, network calls, filesystem access, or code execution paths.

content.value_statement: Managing virtual machines across Proxmox nodes requires navigating complex interfaces and remembering multiple API endpoints. This skill provides a unified interface to create, monitor, and control VMs directly through natural language commands.
actual_capabilities: List virtual machines on Proxmox nodes with status and resource allocation
Start, stop, reboot, suspend, and resume virtual machines
Create new VMs with basic or advanced configuration options
Clone existing VMs and manage templates for rapid deployment
Monitor VM performance metrics and resource utilization
Update VM configurations including CPU, memory, and storage resources
limitations: Requires access to a Proxmox VE environment with API credentials
Does not create or manage Proxmox clusters or nodes directly
Cannot modify VM network settings beyond resource configuration
Limited to VM operations defined in the available tool set

use_cases.title: Automate VM Lifecycle
use_cases.description: Automate start, stop, and scaling operations for development and testing environments.

use_cases.title: Manage Production VMs
use_cases.description: Monitor and maintain virtual machines across multiple Proxmox nodes from a single interface.

use_cases.title: Deploy VM Templates
use_cases.description: Create standardized VM templates and clone them for consistent, repeatable deployments.

prompt_templates.title: List VMs
prompt_templates.scenario: View all VMs on a node
prompt_templates.prompt: List all virtual machines on the production Proxmox node

prompt_templates.title: Check Status
prompt_templates.prompt: What is the current status and resource usage of VM 100

prompt_templates.title: Create VM
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new virtual machine with 4 CPU cores and 8GB RAM on node pve1

prompt_templates.title: Clone Template
prompt_templates.prompt: Clone template VM 100 to create a new VM named web-server-01 with a unique ID

output_examples.input: List all VMs on the production node

best_practices: Use template VMs for consistent, repeatable deployments across your infrastructure
Monitor VM resource utilization regularly to prevent performance bottlenecks
Test all VM changes in non-production environments before applying them to production
anti_patterns: Creating VMs with fixed resources without planning for workload requirements
Skipping graceful shutdown and using immediate stop which can cause data loss
Leaving unused VMs running which consumes resources and increases attack surface

faq.question: Which Proxmox versions are supported?
faq.answer: This skill works with Proxmox VE 7.x and 8.x releases through the standard REST API.

faq.question: What are the resource limits for VM operations?
faq.answer: VM limits depend on your Proxmox cluster resources. Maximums follow your cluster configuration.

faq.question: How do I connect this skill to my Proxmox environment?
faq.answer: Configure Proxmox API credentials in your environment variables before using VM management tools.

faq.question: Is my VM data stored or transmitted externally?
faq.answer: No. All VM operations communicate directly with your Proxmox API. No data leaves your infrastructure.

faq.question: Why did my VM creation fail?
faq.answer: Common causes include insufficient cluster resources, invalid VM ID, or missing required configuration parameters.

faq.question: How does this compare to the Proxmox web UI?
faq.answer: This skill provides faster operations through text commands but the web UI offers visual monitoring and advanced settings.
